title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Satisfies the mathematics requirement of the associate in Arts degree program. Basic statistical procedures are developed. Topics include descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing and confidence intervals and regression using both simulation and a theory-based approach. Technology will be used regularly throughout the course.
Pre-requisites and/or co-requisites: Placement level 2 (see DCC math placement table), OR ENG101 placement level or higher, OR High School GPA of 3.0 (83) or higher.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Satisfies the mathematics requirement of the associate in Arts degree program. Basic statistical procedures are developed. Topics include descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing and confidence intervals and regression using both simulation and a theory-based approach. Technology will be used regularly throughout the course.
Pre-requisites and/or co-requisites: Placement level 2 (see DCC math placement table), OR ENG101 placement level or higher, OR High School GPA of 3.0 (83) or higher.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Course Learning Outcomes
Students who successfully complete the course will be able to:

Calculate and use descriptive statistics (center, variation, outliers).
Understand probability and interpret p-values.
Use Central Limit Theorem and simulation for inferences.
Construct/interpret confidence intervals.
Use hypothesis testing to test claims.
Use technology for statistical simulations.
Perform correlation and regression analysis.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Institutional Student Learning Outcomes

ISLO #4: Quantitative Reasoning. Students will work with graphical, numerical, or symbolic models to solve problems and interpret results.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Instructor Contact & Office Hours

Office: Washington 114 | Phone: 845-431-8554
Email: henry.mendozarivera@sunydutchess.edu


Instructor Office Hours (for help, tutoring, questions, etc)
I am available by appointment for both online and in-person meetings during office hours. To schedule a meeting, please visit Brightspace, navigate to the “Getting Started” section, and click the “Office Hours Appointment” link under Student Resources. You’ll also find the Zoom link for online appointments.
If the available times don’t suit you, please message or email me to arrange a different time that works for both of us. Drop-ins are permitted.
Drop-in Hours (Math & Science Center):



Day
Time
Location




MONDAYS
2:30 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
Washington 126


TUESDAYS
3:30 p.m. – 4:30 p.m.
Washington 126


WEDNESDAYS
2:30 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
Washington 126





Communication Policy

Official Email: The college-supplied email class list will be used to share all critical information. It is imperative that your @sunydutchess.edu email is active and checked regularly.
Subject Line: Students should contact via email using the prefix “MAT118-section number” as the email subject header.



Purpose of Office Hours
Office hours are intended to provide a time for students to:

Clarify concepts: Discuss unclear points from lectures or readings.
Get feedback: Discuss homework assignments or projects and receive feedback on progress.
Explore ideas: Engage in deeper discussions about course topics.
Build relationships: Get to know the instructor and ask questions about the course or career paths.



How to Prepare
To make the most of office hours, students are encouraged to:

Come prepared: Review class materials and attempt homework assignments before visiting.
Identify specific questions: Have clear questions or areas of confusion ready to discuss.
Communicate challenges: If you are struggling, please let me know. We can work together to find effective solutions and support resources.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118

Course Access (Brightspace)
To access the reading and videos for the course: You will be required to use Brightspace throughout the semester. Readings, videos, assignments, and tests will be found in Brightspace and you will turn in work through Brightspace. Access Link: https://mylearning.suny.edu/d2l/home

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Absence and Late Work Policy

Computer Work: NEVER accepted late. Two drops provided.
Written Homework: NEVER accepted late. One drop provided.
Exams/Quizzes: Email instructor on or before the day of. Makeup within 48 hours.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Academic Dishonesty & Integrity
The College regards academic dishonesty in any form as a breach of academic ethics. Violation results in a zero; a second offense results in an F for the course.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
Study Time & Conduct
You are expected to spend at least nine hours a week studying. Read actively, master formulas, and arrive to class on time. Arrange personal business outside of class hours.

title: Elementary Statistics (OER) - MAT 118
text:
AI Policy
AI is an emerging technology. It is inaccurate, so students must not use AI to try and ”fact-find” unless they follow up with their own legitimate research. Students in this course must not use AI in any way to generate material for any assignment unless explicitly instructed by the teacher to do so.
